subject: Re: [junit] Embedding multiple Tests into a loop...
msgSnippet: Maybe you could produce an exception when it fails and capture the error that way by putting the loop within a try catch statement. -H ...
messageBody:
Maybe you could produce an exception when it fails and capture the error that
way by putting the loop within a try catch statement.

-H


--- tsmets@... wrote:
>
>
> I've few tests that generically will load files & validate if the files are
> correct or not. I define the filenames into a String array so the test are
> always correctly run (more or less looping according to the array size).
> The trouble is that as soon as one of the test on the files fails looping is
> either stopped or I don't get any feed back in the JUnit window.
>
> Could someone give me an idea over the way to improve this ?
